transcript.content: Since You Been Gone by Rainbow, since we've been gone, Steve, what's been going on, mate?
Well so much has happened, hasn't it, in the world, you know, in politics and stuff, there's been an election, and the like.
I'm Ricky Gervais, with me Steve Merchant and our producer.
Ricky and Steve giggle.
I say 'producer'.
Yeah.
Karl Pilkington.
Alright?
Yeah very good, we've been away a while, I think the last show we did was January 2004.
Yeah, yeah.
... and nothing's changed.
Nothing's changed whatsoever.
...nothing's been mended. I mean I'm pretty sure I threw that away in the bin.
Yeah.
Before I went, before I left.
...yeah there's some of your old bacon rinds from that sandwich, still left over there.
Yeah, the spare ribs on the floor, yeah nothing's changed at all, oh act- that's not true, the listenership's changed, it went down slightly didn't on the last rate chart.
Well I don't know, I don't know, is that, is that what happened? Did it go down slightly, Karl?
A little bit I think.
I don't think Xfm gets new listeners, I think what happens is, the reason it goes down, just very slightly each time is their old listeners die, you know, old Cure fans dying of...
Yeah, ya' know...Smack addictions.
Yeah! Gout! Well, but anyway, I haven't listened to this station for a year and a half, so that's increased by one which is probably quite a high percentage.
Exactly!
Um.. So, um
Well, I suppose, my question to you Rick would be, you know, why now, why come back now?
Bit bored, bored of sitting at home, ya' know.
Okay.
Yeah.
Cos we're just here for six weeks.
Six weeks, well, we're standing in for Adam and Joe aren't we?
Yeah.
Yeah?
Ah, the tables have turned, I remember when they were standing in for us, but uh...
Yeah, I...don't...
Well, the only reason I'm here is that my housekeeper cleans between 1 and 3.
Oh right that's a good idea.
So I thought I'd nip, get out of the house.
And, er, are they listening to Xfm?
Well no she doesn't speak English. I'm not made of money, Rick.
Ricky screeches with laughter.
You know, if I can help out a young immigrant lady, then um, then I will do, and there are so many things I can do for her, in so many ways.
Yeah, yeah.

But her picking up my old tea towels and stuff is ideal, so that's why I'm here, but I just- all I'm worried about is, I think people kind of associate with the name Ricky Gervais, they associate a certain level of quality, you know, your live stand up DVDs, there's a level of quality, you put a lot of work into them, you've honed it. The TV work you've done likewise. Should people expect the same from the radio show?
Definitely not.
No.

Definitely not. Those things, you, you, you know, you sit down, we write them, for a long time, we write 'em for a year, maybe, then film them, we worry about everything, this is, I really... I'm not even sure I'm talking into the mic at the moment.
Steve laughs.
I was actually doodling as you saw there. I'm eating a sandwich as we speak.
Yeah.
You know, you know, if you... although we do like music. That is true.
That's absolutely right.
Should we just play some great records?
Let's play a great record now.
U2, City of Blinding Light, I'll tell you what, I love U2 now.
Yeah?
I honestly hated them, sort of everything from Boy up to about, I think...
Ricky pauses to contemplate U2's back catalogue.
...Beautiful Day, when that came out, I thought 'oh that's alright', listened to the album, listened to this album, I love 'em now Steve. That's a turnaround innit.
Well yeah, it's that kind of musical insight that I'm looking for throughout this show.
I sounded like Dr Fox then didn't I?
Yeah, just finding out some of your tastes and wants and needs...
Dr Fox, what's happened to him? Is he off air now?
No-one answers.

Cos that's one of the reasons I put no effort into this radio show. Because, you know, we go to the Golden Globes, the same month we do nothing at The Sony, and Dr Fox actually said 'that's because you're not very good.'
I like the fact that the Dr Fox criticisms really hit you quite hard.
Ricky cackles.
You know...
Still talking about it a year later.
Exactly, you gotta let it go Rick.
Yeah.
But then again, you know he is a medical man.
Yeah, well you know you gotta believe him.
Trust his opinion.

Exactly, yeah, yeah, I could have done without the rectal examination, I think he could have just said 'you're not very good, try and enunciate, not 'I know what the problem is, oh let's have a look down here.'
Exactly.
Karl had to... you had to go to one of those Well clinics didn't you?
No, I haven't gone.
Why?
Cos I'm not happy with it.
What?
I'm not happy with the whole, it's just, do people know what them places, places are...
Well they give you a whole...
Have you heard of them?
Well I've had one, yeah. They, they take, they check everything.
Which, you know, Suzanne me girlfriend was like, you know, you're 30-odd now, when was the last time you went to the doctor's and I hadn't been for ages, cos I...
I know, I never go, I never go, unless I honestly think I'm gonna die there in agony.
They can always find something.
Jane made me go to one of those Well things. Those Bupa things, where they do, yeah, couple a hundred quid and they give you complete head to toe, don't they...
But, but, head to bottom...
Ricky sniggers.
...is what it is. They do they old... finger up the arse thing.
Now, what is that testing for?
What I like is, he said it quietly, cos he's on the radio, you can't say arse, say it quietly.
Steve laughs.

Say it quietly, yeah, yeah. (quietly) arse, arse. That was what our mistake was, cos we got a complaint upheld didn't we, for saying, and I'm talking about a male chicken here, which is a cock as you know, but we said that word right, so if we had gone (quietly) “cock”, we would probably have gotten away with it.
You can get away with murder if you just whisper it.
So go on, go on then, yeah, so...
I just, I just, I'm not going, cos I'm not having that done, I don't understand, what they're gonna find up there, that's...
Ricky cackles loudly.
Your head?
Ricky cackles again.
Why can't, why can't they, you know it's the heart I worry about, the most.
Ricky cackles again.
You mean that in a kind of romantic sense?
No, I mean like, you know...
They'd have to have a long finger wouldn't they, to check that out, they go 'there's something wrong with your left ventricle.'
This thing about... this thing about doctors, they hold your testicles and they make you cough.
Yeah, they don't hold your testicles any more, they just put it like by the side of them.
...and what is that testing for?

I don't know, I think it's something to do with, if you've got something wrong with your diaphragm or something like that, you can't do it when they press there, I don't know, it shows them something, it's not doctors having a quick feel.
So...
Karl makes an 'unsure' noise.
Ricky cackles.
Well, that's good, cos you remember when Karl said he's gonna die of cancer, and I said 'why?' and he said 'I don't check me balls', I said 'why?', he said 'I don't like the feel'.
Steve laughs.
So they feel it for ya, they feel 'em for ya and you can just relax, shut your eyes and think of England.
Well don't mess with 'em.
What do you mean?
You can do more damage messing about with them, just leave 'em. There's two anyway, you can afford to lose one.
Yeah... I don't think that's the point, I think the point is it sort of spreads doesn't it, you know, you've gotta check...
Yeah, I mean I'm not saying, you know, don't do it, cos they spend a lot of money saying to people have a quick feel if you've got the time what have you.
Ricky and Steve giggle.
But I don't worry about it, leave it. Leave it alone.
(Laughing) Why?
Why out of interest, why do doctors stick fingers up your (quietly) arse.
To check your prostate.
Check your prostate?
Yeah cos if it's swollen, yeah, it can, you know, it can lead to all sorts of problems. Again, they're not having a laugh Karl. They're not going, “here y'are, look at this little bald Manc fella...
There's no nice way...
...I'll feel his balls, stick a finger up his arse and send him home, 300 quid please, on you go.” 'What about me heart?' “It's fine.” They're all laughing.
“Roger, Geoff, stand behind that two-way mirror...”
Yeah! “Watch this!”
Oh I'm not going anyway.
Really? You're not going cos you...
No I'm not happy with that, it doesn't even matter, it's not the fact that it's a stranger, if it was someone who I knew... it would be just as bad.
(Exploding with laughter) That would be worse!! Imagine that! At a dinner party, oh god, “oh hello, hello Roger and Selina, do you mind, Roger, do you mind...”
Would you allow any of the celebrity doctors to do it though, Dr Dre?
Dr Fox?
Any of those?
Dr Who?
I just don't understand in this day and age, why...
Would you allow Christopher Ecclestone to stick his big Northern finger up your...
Let's... do you want a song on anyway?
What? Beanie Sigel, I love this track.
This is very urban for you Rick.
Beanie Sigel - Feel it in the Air
Beanie Sigel - Feel it in the Air. Beautiful track, isn't it?
Oh, it's wonderful, and on a lovely summer's day like this as well, Rick, it's the ideal choice. Wonderful, that one.

Well, I'm a little bit worried that If there are any new listeners - very unlikely - that they may, you know, be familiar with our work, but they might not know the, the wonderful little gem that we found, just there, a little rough diamond in the, in the... mud.
Yeah.
Karl Pilkington.
Yeah.
Just working here, just working away as a little producer, little sound man.
A drone.
Yeah. And we gave him his opportunity, didn't we?
Mmmm...
It's like Cinderella, wasn't it?
Yep. And he grasped that opportunity, didn't you? - by the horns. And three years later you're exactly where you started.....
Ricky laughing
....So, good work.
I've got Mondays off now.
Riotous laughter from Rick and Steve
Well, I thought maybe a useful way of introducing the mind of Karl Pilkington...
Yeah
....to our new audience....
You use that term loosely.
Yeah, when I say 'mind', I don't ..... yeah
Ricky laughing
Yeah
Um, I thought what, what....
Look at his face!
Ah! There is a website, have you got the website address?
Oh, there's a website that we've just found. Right, Karl, what is the address?
If you are unfamiliar with what Karl looks like....
Please log onto this now.
Log onto this website and stay tuned, but just... log onto the website, 'cos you'll see Karl's face, you'll see some of his pearls of wisdom....
Yeah. And what's it, what's the address, Karl?
Uhhh...freewebs dot com....
Doubleyou doubleyou doubleyou dot...
Yep... freewebs dot com
....freewebs dot com
Yep... forward slash
Yeah
Uh, the dash K dash man, forward slash...
The K-man. It's complicated.
It is, yeah.
Do it again. Say it again. But get a pencil....they've all got a pencil now...
Freewebs dot com...
One word.
..slash the dash K dash man forward slash.
Now, when you say 'dash', is it a dash or is it an underscore?
Is it an underscore, is it in the middle of the word, or... does it hover in the middle of the word, or is it at the bottom?
It's just a line, and that.
Yeah, I know, but is it an underscore or is it a dash?
Try both.
Hoots of laughter from Ricky and Steve
He copied it down!
(???) have a go.
Ricky's laugh intensifies
That's the sort of level we're talking about.
Well, already you've got some insight into the mind of Karl Pilkington.
Ricky's laugh subsides
Yeah, absolutely, yeah...
But I thought what we should do is we could (???)hi-jack..
Ricky's laugh starts up again
(???)Imagine that. Imagine Bill Gates -
Yeah. Or a teacher -
A teach-
- in an exam: 'Pop down both'.
Ricky's laugh becoming a chicken's squawk
Multiple choice!
Yeah,
Yeah, okay....

But, anyway, yeah, if you're a reader of the Weekend Guardian, you'll know there's this thing called the Q&A, which they give to celebrities and thinkers, and the like. And basically it's a series of questions they pose to people each week, and it's the same questions. And it gives a little insight into people's minds, the way they think.
What particular, what thinker-philosopher is in this week's?
Steve laughs
It's the lead singer of Feeder.
Ricky laughs.
So, um....you're in good company, Karl.
No, I like Feeder.
No, fine.
I love Feeder.

So, Karl, I'm just gonna fire a couple of these questions at you. We'll really drop them in throughout the course of this show, just to try and get a sense of who you are. Um... so here's the first up, first question, alright? Got your thinking head on?
Go on.
You wurzel.
What is your idea of perfect happiness?
Ehhh....what, for me, or...?
Or every-
No, Ronnie Corbett.
No, no, but what... Do you mean, like, what would make me happy, or for everyone to be happy.
No, what would make you happy. Maybe that is, maybe that's the answer - your idea of perfect happiness is everyone being happy. I don't know. What's your, what would make you totally....
Unlikely, Rick. I imagine it's a twenty-four-hour monkey channel on, like, Sky...
Ricky laughs
Yeah, yeah...Okay, go on. A never-ending popsicle.
What's your idea of perfect happiness?
Go on, go on....
Ehhh....I don't think I've had it yet, where I'm like really, really happy with anything.
Karl, I've never seen you really happy, no.
No, but....um...
When have you been at your happiest?
Probably... I like, sort of, fish fingers, potato cakes and beans, for a... for tea.
Yeah. You're not...yeah.
Right, well, let's move on. We'll come back to that one.
I don't think you're aiming high enough for, uh...
Well, what would your answer be for that? When are you happy? What would make you happy?
I wouldn't have the, I'd have fish fingers, but I probably wouldn't have the potato cakes.
Yeah
I'd have fish fingers and beans.
See, I'm not a huge fan of the beans.
Really? So your idea of perfect happiness is probably just fish fingers, is it?
Just the fish fingers.
Okay, good.
Alright, second question: what is your greatest fear, Karl.
Mmm...going to the doctor's.
So, so...presumably, uh, ill health and mortality.
Ehhhh....
No, just the doctor's.
No, I don't-
Any particular doctor?
I don't want to live forever, either.
No, no...
I just want a good innings. I just want to get to about eighty....eighty-three, eighty-four?
Ricky laughs
So specific....so specific! Yeah, okay...
Which living person do you most admire?
Long pause
Ehhhh.....
Another long pause
Which person throughout any time in history do you most admire?
Winston Churchill's pretty good.
You like him?
Yeah. Very good.
Yeah, he's alright.
Why?
Good answer.
'Cos, if it wasn't for him, we'd be talking German. And I'm not that good at that. So...
Ricky laughs

(???) he's not that good at that. I love the fact that even if the Nazis won, right, in 1945, and we'd be now speaking German, he still wouldn't be that good at it. Although he's not good at English. So, yeah, I suppose he's, I suppose that's true, isn't it? Yeah...
Alright, well, here's one, here's the final one for now. Do you believe in capital punishment?
Ehhhh....
That's not hitting Dr Fox over the head with a stick.
Steve laughs
Depends....depends what for, doesn't it?
Go on.
Oh, if it's something bad. And uh...
Well, I assume it would be. They don't, they don't kill people now for parking illegally.
But what sort of, what sort of thing are you talking about? What sort of punishment?
Capital punishment.
Yeah, I know, but what is that, what are you talking about?
Well, guillotine, hanging...
Uhhhh...hanging's a bit bad.
Yeah. Can be fatal, can't it? What do you mean hanging's a bit bad?
It's just....
It's all bad. Why kill, why should the state kill someone.
Because prisons are getting a bit busy, aren't they?
Brilliant.
I just, what's, what's the point in keeping them a- you know, people, people around...
Well, what's the point in killing them?
Just 'cos it's like, 'Right, that's that done. Who's next?' (???)
Ricky and Steve laughing
What can you do with someone if they're mental?
Ricky and Steve laugh louder
Employ them on a radio show!!!
Yeah
Play a record, Karl.
Right, next question
Play a record. We'll come back to the questions.
I've, uhh, what do you want, what have you got in here?
Rick, I know you're a massive fan of The Thorns.
Yeah, I love them.
Maybe you're less familiar with the different elements of The Thorns' solo work.
No, I...
This is a track from Matthew Sweet.
Oh, yeah.
Matthew Sweet - In My Time
Xfm 104.9, Matthew Sweet and a song called 'In My Time', Ricky Gervais, Steve Merchant, Karl Pilkington.
It's great that.
Yeah, just asking Karl some of these Q&A questions.

This might be my idea of perfect happiness, being in a room with Karl Pilkington, just watching him, I just watch him look around, when you're talking he looks at you and it's like you know when an owner says it's like the cat can understand what I'm saying, he's on the edge of that, the edge of that, you think he can and I know he understands the words, but I don't think he understands the full impact. He never, whenever you say something to him, it might be something, a revelation, he always picks up on the wrong side but that's not the important bit, you know what I mean? He always goes...
It's a bit like having a 14-year-old French exchange student, their English isn't amazing, they roughly understand you, they're trying to piece together what you're saying...
Exactly. But it's great you see the thing about Karl is, and don't take this the wrong way, I like him because he's stupid, in a way.
Karl makes an aggrieved noise.
Ricky laughs.

Look! I'm not being funny, but do you know what I mean? But even though I think he is considered stupid, some of the things he says, I think borders on the, I don't know what the PC term is, the retarded.
Steve laughs.
Do you know what I mean Karl?
Anything in particular you're thinking of there Rick, when you think of the...?

Well, um, he was talking to me the other day that I'm trying to write a show called Science and he's sort of gonna help me out with some of the research. I want him to do something on the DVD for it right, and he was talking about it and he's talking about, he says like in the future they reckon we'll be able to, soon he said, they'll be able to take us into space and it's going to cost us £150,000 and said what's the point, there's nothing up there. He said when they went up there right, he said when Louis Armstrong went in 1966.
Steve laughs.

Right, he said there was nothing there, there was him, a fellow called Buzz and there was one, the third bloke who didn't even get out of the spaceship. He said he went all that way he didn't get out to stretch his legs, how good can it be? Forget it.
Steve hoots.
That's him summing up space exploration.
Don't you agree with that? What's the point in going up there?
Because you're expanding...
Are we talking about the finger in the arse again here, or in space?
What is the point in going?

Because you're expanding, you know, human endeavour aren't you and human understanding of the world and the universe, what else are we going to do as a civilisation, as a people if we're not constantly searching and reaching out into the far distance.
But there's nothing there!
I know some people you grew up with haven't left their street, but that's not everyone.
What do you mean there is nothing there though? What has got to be there for it to be a worthwhile ...
Just something.
Like what ...
What would you be happy with finding up on the moon?
A Blockbuster video?

Just, just ... just something. I don't think they looked hard enough anyway when they got there, cos they seemed to get out, have a bit of a dance about and then they came straight back and I sort of think, you know, did they look properly?
It's not a day trip is it?
But what I mean is ...
But they took that car up there this didn't they and drove around a bit.
Yeah but only a little bit. What I mean is say if an alien landed in Africa there's not much there so they go 'pff...'.
What do you mean there's not much there?
It's a bit barren innit.
What, Africa? Just in general?
Well, anywhere like that, desert or whatever, what I'm saying is have a good look round.
It's got ... probably where all life came from and probably half a million species of animal live there ...
Yeah I just mean buildings and that and stuff.
Oh buildings.
Just stuff.
Yeah.

I mean, did they look properly? Or did they just land, get out, go 'uh, bit dusty' whatever. 'Right, let's go back.' I just think it's a bit pointless, especially when we haven't done everything there is to do here.
Go on.
Well, I don't know but I'm sure there is stuff ... that needs sorting out.
Well, I know of a place that no medical man has been ...
Steve sniggers.
In this room ... there's definitely an unexplored cavern, sitting right in front of ...
Alright Steve, would you go to the moon if someone said there's a space.

He doesn't mosh at a concert because he's scared his glasses might fall off, of course he wouldn't go to the moon, they'd spin him around in training, his glasses would come off and that would be it, he'd feel sick.
My worry is that I'd have to cos, would I be able to wear them under the helmet?
Ricky laughs.
Imagine him!
Like, I went paintballing once and I had to wear the glasses underneath the mask and course it was hot weather it was awful it steamed up in there.
Ricky laughs.
It was terrible, I couldn't see anything, I got shot straight away, I was out of the game. It was pointless. It cost me like eight quid.
You don't have to be that fit anyway do you? You're only sort of sat there.
Well ... no ... well yeah ... what are you talking about? Think of g-force alone and weightlessness, of course you've got to be ... what?

I think when you said 'think of g-force', he thought of G4, the follow-up winners in Pop Idol, I could see it as his eyes glazed over, a couple more quick questions for you Karl, just to get inside your mind, um, what is your greatest regret?
Probably, I didn't do that well at school did I? So I'm trying to, like, learn stuff now.
Yeah. How is that going?
Not mentally ...
He reckons he has learned more in the last three months than in the rest of his life, reading a couple of science books that I gave him.
Well, that's impressive. We'll test you on that later on.
Yeah.
What keeps you awake at night?
Well, I live in, sort of, central London don't I, so it's ...
Brilliant.
... noisy.
Traffic. I think they were thinking more ...
What, what, fears have you got, what worries, do you ponder the expansion of the universe, do you worry about ...
There's no point, there's no point is there, because there's nothing I can do about it.
So with you it's what, the little Chinese fella across the road?
Just, just stuff that I've got to sort out, you know any bills or anything, I don't worry about the world ending or anything, what's the point in that?
Yeah that's true, that is true.

I can't do anything about it. I always think that people with more, sort of, intelligence have the world on their shoulders. Cos they're worrying about stuff that is miles away, where I'm like happy if the sun's out, it's like 'oh it's a nice day'.
Very Zen.
But I don't worry about wars and stuff going on, cos there's nowt I can do.
What would you do if there was a war that maybe there was...
What here?
Yeah.
Go on holiday.
Ricky laughs.
Play a record Karl.
Foo Fighters - Best of You.
The Who. I mean that's gotta be one of the best rock tracks ever hasn't it?
I agree.
Did I sound like Dr.Fox again?
A little bit. It's a good thing.
Yeah, it's a good thing isn't it? Yeah. We're going to get a Sony award this year. Karl, how you doing?
I'm alright yeah
It's good to be back isn't it?
We doing Rockbusters in a bit or what?
Have we got Rockbusters?
Well..
Hallelujah!
I'll tell you this, new listeners won't believe their luck when they hear Rockbusters.
Hold on, we've got Rockbusters, have we got, dare I say it, have we got Monkey News Karl?
Erm, well I've been away haven't I? So I've sort of got a few things that I've read about roughly, but I don't know the full ins and outs.
You're joking, because usually you do your research quite well, you get it off Ananova and read the top line.
What are you saying though? Are you saying that it's kind of Monkey News?
Well, we might have time to do some later.
Well we've got to have Monkey News.
I love it when he teases us with his Monkey News.
We've had E-mails about that website address..
Yeah..
It was a, what's its name, underscore.
An underscore, ok, so give it out one more time, go to this to find out about Karl Pilkington, someones put a lot of effort, it's a really good websites, there's some great pictures of Karl.
It's, well they're not great, it's just..erm.. Freewebs.com/The_K_Man/
Ok, forward slashes all the way.
Yeah.
Except the underscores.
Except the underscores, yeah.
This is interminable, isn't it interminable giving out website addresses?
I know yeah
Rubbish. It's so boring.
Yeah. Is he enjoying the show?
He just says, "I love spending two hours on a Saturday listening about finger parties, doctors squeezing testicles and making you cough, have you got any news on the Hairy Chinese Kid?"
Well when you say it like that some of the stuff we come up with does sound a little, you know, drivel, sometimes.
Well...yeah..

Karl was worried about swearing, because we were talking about fingers up the arse and that he was getting a bit worried. I don't have a problem with swearing but I see why you can't say some words on radio, it might be offensive to the people listening, you know the F word, the C word and all those, but when they bleep it out in a record, they bleep out the vowel. So in the F word they bleep out the U so it goes FbleepCK. So they go 'It's not offensive I didn't hear the vowel'?
Presumably, yeah.
So if you change the vowel? It's not? You know what I mean? So yeah, in the C word can I say..Can I talk about the philosopher Immanuel Kant?
Well you can talk about Immanuel Kant because he's one of the great thinkers of all time
So Kant is not an offensive word because the vowel is different?
Leave it then
You know what I mean though?
I can see how it can be offensive
No, but..
You can't. He's a thinker, a philosopher, his name is Kant, that's his actual name, he hasn't changed his name. I think he comes from a long line of Kants. I think his Father is, his Grandfather..
Yeah, alright..
They're all different German people.
Germany is, I assume, full of Kants.
Yeah.
What?
So what else was on.
So you can change the vowel, so could I say..erm..could I say..
Probably not.
What if I change two words? What if I say cump? C, U, M, P. That's not offensive at all is it?
That can't be offensive.
So I could say you folcking cump?
Alright, ok.
I need a shnit.
Ricky Laughs
That'll be fine.
Wonker, Willy Wonka.
Yeah.
Willy Wonka. Although, Willy, is willy offensive? Because you say Willy.
It's tricky.
Willy Wonka and his folcking cumps. That'll be fine.
That'll be absolutely fine.
Is that alright Karl?
Got any other questions or anything Steve?

Not as much a question but its something I think might be of interest to you Karl, I was reading this in the paper and I don't know how fascinated you are by people of the Japanese persuasion, erm, two elderly men found on a remote island are thought to be Japanese soldiers, in hiding since 1945 desperate to go home. Diplomats from Tokyo are investigating the claims of these men who are 87 and 83.
Hmm.
What? What are you thinking there?
No, go on.
I know what you're thinking, I know what you're thinking, go on, say what you're thinking
Are they that old though?
Why? Why? Say why.
I don't want to. Just leave it.
Karl's got a theory, well, I mean, I don't think this is fine, Karl's views don't reflect the views of XFM. Right, Karl's got a theory that Oriental people don't age well.
Sure. No let Karl..

Of course, Yeah. Yeah.

Um. And it's got- it's got Kiss, Judas Priest, Deep Purple, The Darkness. I mean, it really is good. It's all it's all your classic, rock tracks. The other reason I wanted to play it is because I like that song, I think it's a great little uptempo bubblegum pop song, rock, you know, great, but it's got one of the worst lyrics in it. He's, uh, you know, he's worried about, um, bringing up the fact that he loves his girlfriend's, his- his, his, uh mate's girlfriend. And he goes, should I bring it up? He goes, uh "Oh I'd, you know, I'd tell her that I love her, but, the point may be moot."
Steve hoots
Just-
You don't use that in a rock song!
[He laughs] I know, yeah
"The point may be moot."
Ricky laughs

Well, I was listening to, Christian O'Connell on the breakfast show when he had this bounty hunter thing running a couple weeks back. And, I don't know what happened. But, anyway, he ended up with Bryan Adams in the studio doing a live session. Bryan, you know, good natured or whatever.
Yeah.
But you can't help but feel with Brian that he sort of he thinks that he's Bruce Springsteen.
Yeah.
But there's something wrong. I mean, he's got the voice and the guitar. He can play and everything,
Yep

But there was a lyric, and he he he played it completely earnestly, and it was a session, and the lyric was something it was from his recent album. And the lyric was along the lines of I'm paraphrasing, but it was along the lines of, "I'm sat in my hotel room. There's a knock at the door, and I get kinda nervous. I'm hoping it's you. It's just room service."
Ricky laughs

Which is extraordinary. But Christian came up with the best- it came- they finished it. And, obviously, Christian is thinking, what could I say? And he came up with the best answer if you've had a session that you're not entirely convinced by. He just said quite simply: "That sounded great."
That's good.
Which is amazing.
Yeah.
That- Who are you complimenting there? The engineer.
Ricky laughs
You know what I mean? It's like, the sound recordist... what does that mean?
That's great.
"That sounded great."
Yeah. Good. We got some good mics.
Yeah. Yeah. Yeah.
Oh, Bryan Adams. Is it true he bought the pub next door to him and closed it down because they were noisy?
I hope so.
Yeah. That's a good- that's what money's for. That is what money's for, isn't it?
Exactly. Absolutely right.
Waking Up the Neighbors. That was his album, wasn't it?
Yeah.
That was right-
I don't know if that was before or after that, whether it was related or not.
Well, if you buy a house next to a pub, you know what you're gonna get.
Yeah.
So move rather than ruining the fun for everyone.
It's more good advice from Karl Pilkington.
[indistinct] , innit?
Karl, while we're talking to you, we should give these answers to Rockbusters. It's the big quiz. And, of course, the winner this week goes forward to play in the grand final
Alright.
...In six weeks' time where they get to win all these amazing gifts. We've decided-

All that stuff yeah

...for Karl by Matt Groening, uh, Nigel Tuffnell signed rare poster. They're they're amazing. We should give away a sort of, maybe a-a- original print behind the scenes of Extras. We got some amazing pictures-
Yeah, a lot of good stuff

...filming extras. I was thinking the other day, you know, like, I'm how excited I am to be with Karl and let off corks on his head. Well, I read, long suffering editor Nigel. We've worked with Ben Stiller, Kate Winslet, Sam Jackson, all these people for eight weeks. It was amazing. But my highlight I- I was- I thought about it. And my highlight was dressing Nigel up, our editor in a baby grow.
Sure.

Yeah.
And it's just-
And that is BBC license fee money going towards you dressing up your editor. Because you didn't pay for it.
[Through laughter] No
The BBC paid for it. So that is how your money is being spent, people.
But, but it's available on the DVD again. Nothing's wasted.
Which you have to buy for fifteen quid.
Ricky laughs
Sure. So, yeah, it's a win-win situation
It's- it's like it's the whole thing is one big reality game show, isn't it?
Yeah.
Oh. so-
Anyway, the answers give us- the give us the-
Go on. Give us the clue. I haven't got an idea. Go on. Give me the clue then again.
Right. Well, do you wanna say who the winner is or?
No.
Oh alright then.
Let's hear the answers first.
Uh, first- first clue was, if you get a bulb when it's young, you look after it and that. You teach it stuff.
Yeah.
What's going on there?
Go on.
The Initial was R.
Yeah.
Right? That was that was Razorlight. Alright?
Raise a light. You raise a light.
Raise a light.
Kinda works.
Second one-
Yeah. It did matter what sort of bulb it was then.
Mmhm
It was very specific.
Thought it might. Go on.

People have a problem doing this when they get home from a night out drinking. Yeah. What's the problem they're having? They have a problem getting the key in. Getting the key in, and that. Key in, keyin, Keane. That's the...

I mean, horrific. But, anyway, we're gonna give it, and he goes forward, as I say, for the big prize the big prizes is in six weeks' time. It's Paul in Bookham. Well done, Paul.

Right, ready?

Just firing up.

Good. So you're just doing it.
Hold on. Now it's in position. What if it ... oh, Ready?
Yep.
Oh, god it- Oh!
Pop!

I'm just thinking back to some of the highlights, Rick, so far today. I don't know what you've made of it.

That isn't swearing. Um... Cork, cork on the head, c- champagne down the electrical... works.

Oh. There's been no monkey news, you can't get?
No, no. But I haven't had had a proper chance to sort of, you know, uh..
Karl, your monkey news is of spurious tales from the seventeenth century sometimes. So let's have one of those.
No it's all new

Let's have a monkey that who dressed as Zoro, and they thought he was, a woodsman. But when they took his head off, he was only- he was a four foot hairy chimp. Let's have one of those ridiculous stories.
Well, we've we've done that, though. But, do you wanna go back on some of the ones and that we've- sort of recap-
Oh for f- Just what is the monkey news?! There must have been some m-monkey news this week.
Right. The only thing that sort of stood out do you know, like, they're having problems...
You're just making this up. Where's your informa- where's the piece of paper? Where's the document? What is this?
Because I've been away, so I haven't got anything, I've walked in today.
Right- look- let's- let's just hear him out

Let's hear it out.
Right. Do you know, like, they're having problems getting new, new, uh people to be policemen?
Oh, for ffff.

They're taking what on?

OK.

Well, they can't talk.

What, so it's one way? They they tell them- They've got the little thing strapped to them?

Well, I'll- I'll get some better stuff next week, but I've literally, like, got off a plane a few hours ago.
This is the worst- this is one of the worst shows we've ever done.
And that's saying something, Rick.
This is-
Cos we've done some tripe.
This is nothing. And to end with the "the police in America have given monkeys walkie talkies." That's nothing. That is a disgrace.
And what do you mean that you've not had enough time to prepare? We've been off air for eighteen months!
Yeah!

synopsis.description: Foot long spider that eats chicken worries Karl
Bad song lyrics and offhand compliments "That sounded great"
Popping a cork on Karl's head
Monkey news: Chimps on the SWAT team
